New Records: Mookie Betts hit his second career walk-off home run, and first with the Dodgers.
Shohei Ohtani completed a four-hit performance with his 53rd, and perhaps most important, home run of the season.
Key Match Events: Mookie Betts and Shohei Ohtani hit back-to-back home runs in the ninth inning for a walk-off 6-5 win at Dodger Stadium.
Kiké Hernández started the comeback with a two-run homer in the seventh inning, trimming a 5-1 deficit in half.
Freddie Freeman cashed Ohtani's steal of second base with an RBI single, making it 5-4.
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Dave Roberts emphasized the importance of strong bullpen performance.
The manager set a six-inning target for Yoshinobu Yamamoto's start, but he struggled through a four-run, three-inning start.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Dave Roberts said, 'That felt like two wins,' after the Dodgers' comeback win.
Mookie Betts expressed pride in the team's resilience after the comeback win.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers are still three games up on the Padres in the standings, with their magic number to clinch the division down to four.
The Padres have won seven of 10 games against the Dodgers this year.
